intro: Argostemma coenosciadicum, commonly known as the broad-leaved argostemma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and a distinctive, fragrant flower cluster. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and numerous stamens. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
